First, the principle of oneness, second, the principle of oneness in events.
Just as in one's own enjoyment, the pure lands of the TathÄgatas in the ten directions are the same and cannot be said to be nonexistent, yet they can be called one.
Therefore, the treatise forms four statements, with two pairs being different.
Moreover, the above briefly presents four statements to completely block errors, but in reality, they are both different and the same, both existent and nonexistent.
If they mutually negate each other, then one and different are both absent, and existence and nonexistence are both quiescent.
If they are perfectly integrated without obstruction, then they are both one and many, both existent and nonexistent.
Existence is existence within nonexistence, and nonexistence is nonexistence within existence. Many is many within one, and one is one within many.

Existence and nonexistence are unobstructed in terms of phenomena and principle, and one and many are unobstructed in terms of phenomena and phenomena. Because of this layer upon layer, the Dharma realm is seen in each particle of the Huayan world.
